wikipedia_page.main: Second Lieutenant Henry Cope Evans  (26 July 1880 – 3 September 1916) was a World War I flying ace credited with five aerial victories, all gained while flying the Airco DH.2.

link_mentions.page: List of people with surname Evans
response: **Henry Evans (RFC officer) (1879–1916), British aviator and flying ace
**John Henry Evans (1872–1947), American Mormon educator and writer
* Henry Evans (Evanion) (1832–1905), conjurer, ventriloquist and humorist
* Henry Evans (RFC officer) (1880–1916), British aviator and flying ace
* Shepherd Book, a fictional character in the TV series Firefly and the sequel film Serenity, born as Henry Evans

* British flying ace Henry Evans was shot down by ground fire over northern France while doing an offensive patrol for the British Fourth Army. He had five confirmed kills at the time giving him the title of flying ace.
